verses.verse: Know this, that in the last days, fierce times will stand here.
You see, the people will be fond of themselves, fond of money, egoistic, proud, hurtful, unbelieving to parents, ungenerous, unholy,
hardhearted toward family, refusing to enter into agreements, accusers, lacking restraint, mean, not fond of good,
traitors, obnoxious, having been blinded by smoke, fond of pleasure rather than fond of God,
having a form of godliness, but having denied its ability. And from these people, turn away.
You see, out of these people are the people who sneak into the houses and incarcerate the wacky women who have been piled with sins, being led by various desires,
always learning and never able to come to a correct understanding of truth.

In the way that Jannes and Jambres stood in opposition to Moses, so these people also stand in opposition to the truth, people who have been entirely worsened by their way of thinking, unapproved concerning the trust.
But they will not progress on to more. You see, their insanity will be quite obvious to everyone, as the insanity of those people also became.
You have followed alongside my instruction, my leading, my purpose, my trust, my patience, my love, my persistence to do what is right,
my persecutions, my hardships (such as happened to me in Antioch, in Iconium, in Lystra). Such persecutions I endured, and from all of them the Master saved me.
All the people who also want to be living godly in the Anointed King Jesus will be persecuted.
Evil people and impostors will progress on to the worse thing, misleading and being misled.
You must stay in what you learned and found reliable, realizing from whose side you learned
and that from a baby you have seen the temple documents, the ones that are able to provide you with insight into rescue through trust, the trust in the Anointed King Jesus.
Every God-breathed writing is also beneficial toward instruction, toward a reprimand, toward rehabilitation, toward the discipline in the right way,
so that the person of God may be developed having been fully developed toward every good action.
